column2: Still, he could not put a whole faith in veteran's tales, for recruits were their prey.
column3: Still, he could not put a whole faith in veteran's tales, for recruits were their prey.

column2: They talked much of smoke, fire, and blood, but he could not tell how much might be lies.
column3: They talked much of smoke, fire, and blood, but he could not tell how much might be lies.

column2: They persistently yelled "Fresh fish!" at him, and were in no wise to be trusted.
column3: They persistently yelled "Fresh fish!" at him, and were in no wise to be trusted.

column2: However, he perceived now that it did not greatly matter what kind of soldiers he was going to fight, so long as they fought, which fact no one disputed.
column3: However, he perceived now that it did not greatly matter what kind of soldiers he was going to fight, so long as they fought, which fact no one disputed.

column2: There was a more serious problem.
column3: There was a more serious problem.

column2: He lay in his bunk pondering upon it.
column3: He lay in his bunk pondering upon it.

column2: He tried to mathematically prove to himself that he would not run from a battle.
column3: He tried to mathematically prove to himself that he would not run from a battle.

column2: Previously he had never felt obliged to wrestle too seriously with this question.
column3: Previously he had never felt obliged to wrestle too seriously with this question.

column2: In his life he had taken certain things for granted, never challenging his belief in ultimate success, and bothering little about means and roads.
column3: In his life he had taken certain things for granted, never challenging his belief in ultimate success, and bothering little about means and roads.

column2: But here he was confronted with a thing of moment. It had suddenly appeared to him that perhaps in a battle he might run. He was forced to admit that as far as war was concerned he knew nothing of himself.
column3: But here he was confronted with a thing of moment. It had suddenly appeared to him that perhaps in a battle he might run. He was forced to admit that as far as war was concerned he knew nothing of himself.

column2: A sufficient time before he would have allowed the problem to kick its heels at the outer portals of his mind, but now he felt compelled to give serious attention to it.
column3: A sufficient time before he would have allowed the problem to kick its heels at the outer portals of his mind, but now he felt compelled to give serious attention to it.

column2: A little panic-fear grew in his mind.
column3: A little panic fear grew in his mind.

column2: As his imagination went forward to a fight, he saw hideous possibilities.
column3: As his imagination went forward to a fight, he saw hideous possibilities.

column2: He contemplated the lurking menaces of the future, and failed in an effort to see himself standing stoutly in the midst of them.
column3: He contemplated the lurking menaces of the future, and failed in an effort to see himself standing stoutly in the midst of them.

column2: He recalled his visions of broken-bladed glory, but in the shadow of the impending tumult he suspected them to be impossible pictures.
column3: He recalled his visions of broken bladed glory, but in the shadow of the impending tumult he suspected them to be impossible pictures.

column2: He sprang from the bunk and began to pace nervously to and fro.
column3: He sprang from the bunk and began to pace nervously to and fro.

column2: Good Lord, what's th' matter with me? he said aloud.
column3: Good Lord, what's t h' matter with me? he said aloud.

column2: He felt that in this crisis his laws of life were useless.
column3: He felt that in this crisis his laws of life were useless.

column2: Whatever he had learned of himself was here of no avail.
column3: Whatever he had learned of himself was here of no avail.

column2: He was an unknown quantity.
column3: He was an unknown quantity.

column2: He saw that he would again be obliged to experiment as he had in early youth.
column3: He saw that he would again be obliged to experiment as he had in early youth.

column2: He must accumulate information of himself, and meanwhile he resolved to remain close upon his guard lest those qualities of which he knew nothing should everlastingly disgrace him. "Good Lord!" he repeated in dismay.
column3: He must accumulate information of himself, and meanwhile he resolved to remain close upon his guard lest those qualities of which he knew nothing should everlastingly disgrace him. "Good Lord!" he repeated in dismay.

column2: After a time the tall soldier slid dexterously through the hole.
column3: After a time the tall soldier slid dexterously through the hole.

column2: The loud private followed.
column3: The loud private followed.

column2: They were wrangling.
column3: They were wrangling.

column2: That's all right, said the tall soldier as he entered.
column3: That's all right, said the tall soldier as he entered.

column2: He waved his hand expressively.
column3: He waved his hand expressively.

column2: You can believe me or not, jest as you like.	You can believe me or not, jest as you like.
column3: true

column2: All you got to do is sit down and wait as quiet as you can.
column3: All you got to do is sit down and wait as quiet as you can.

column2: Then pretty soon you'll find out I was right."
column3: Then pretty soon you'll find out I was right."

column2: His comrade grunted stubbornly.
column3: His comrade grunted stubbornly.

column2: For a moment he seemed to be searching for a formidable reply.
column3: For a moment he seemed to be searching for a formidable reply.

column2: Finally he said: "Well, you don't know everything in the world, do you?"
column3: Finally he said: "Well, you don't know everything in the world, do you?"

column2: Didn't say I knew everything in the world, retorted the other sharply.
column3: Didn't say I knew everything in the world, retorted the other sharply.

column2: He began to stow various articles snugly into his knapsack.
column3: He began to stow various articles snugly into his knapsack.

column2: The youth, pausing in his nervous walk, looked down at the busy figure. "Going to be a battle, sure, is there, Jim?" he asked.
column3: The youth, pausing in his nervous walk, looked down at the busy figure. "Going to be a battle, sure, is there, Jim?" he asked.

column2: Of course there is, replied the tall soldier.
column3: Of course there is, replied the tall soldier.

column2: Of course there is. You jest wait 'til to-morrow, and you'll see one of the biggest battles ever was.	Of course there is. You jest wait 'til to morrow, and you'll see one of the biggest battles ever was.
column3: false

column2: You jest wait."
column3: You jest wait."

column2: Thunder! said the youth.
column3: Thunder! said the youth.

column2: Oh, you'll see fighting this time, my boy, what'll be regular out-and-out fighting, added the tall soldier, with the air of a man who is about to exhibit a battle for the benefit of his friends.
column3: Oh, you'll see fighting this time, my boy, what'll be regular out and out fighting, added the tall soldier, with the air of a man who is about to exhibit a battle for the benefit of his friends.

column2: Huh! said the loud one from a corner.
column3: Huh! said the loud one from a corner.

column2: Well, remarked the youth, "like as not this story'll turn out jest like them others did."
column3: Well, remarked the youth, "like as not this story'll turn out jest like them others did."

column2: Not much it won't, replied the tall soldier, exasperated.
column3: Not much it won't, replied the tall soldier, exasperated.

column2: Not much it won't.	Not much it won't.
column3: true

column2: Didn't the cavalry all start this morning?" He glared about him.
column3: Didn't the cavalry all start this morning?" He glared about him.

column2: No one denied his statement.
column3: No one denied his statement.

column2: The cavalry started this morning, he continued.
column3: The cavalry started this morning, he continued.

column2: They say there ain't hardly any cavalry left in camp. They're going to Richmond, or some place, while we fight all the Johnnies.	They say there ain't hardly any cavalry left in camp. They're going to Richmond, or some place, while we fight all the Johnnies.
column3: false

column2: It's some dodge like that.
column3: It's some dodge like that.

column2: The regiment's got orders, too. A feller what seen 'em go to headquarters told me a little while ago. And they're raising blazes all over camp--anybody can see that."
column3: The regiment's got orders, too. A feller what seen 'em go to headquarters told me a little while ago. And they're raising blazes all over camp-anybody can see that."

column2: Shucks! said the loud one.
column3: Shucks! said the loud one.

column2: The youth remained silent for a time.
column3: The youth remained silent for a time.

column2: At last he spoke to the tall soldier.
column3: At last he spoke to the tall soldier.

column2: Jim!
column3: Jim!

column2: What?
column3: What?

column2: How do you think the reg'ment 'll do?
column3: How do you think the reg'ment 'l l do?

column2: Oh, they'll fight all right, I guess, after they once get into it, said the other with cold judgment.
column3: Oh, they'll fight all right, I guess, after they once get into it, said the other with cold judgment.

column2: He made a fine use of the third person.
column3: He made a fine use of the third person.

column2: There's been heaps of fun poked at 'em because they're new, of course, and all that; but they'll fight all right, I guess.
column3: There's been heaps of fun poked at 'em because they're new, of course, and all that; but they'll fight all right, I guess.

column2: Think any of the boys 'll run? persisted the youth.
column3: Think any of the boys 'l l run? persisted the youth.

column2: Oh, there may be a few of 'em run, but there's them kind in every regiment, 'specially when they first goes under fire, said the other in a tolerant way.
column3: Oh, there may be a few of 'em run, but there's them kind in every regiment, 'specially when they first goes under fire, said the other in a tolerant way.

column2: Of course it might happen that the hull kit-and-boodle might start and run, if some big fighting came first-off, and then again they might stay and fight like fun.	Of course it might happen that the hull kit and boodle might start and run, if some big fighting came first off, and then again they might stay and fight like fun.
column3: false

column2: But you can't bet on nothing.
column3: But you can't bet on nothing.

column2: Of course they ain't never been under fire yet, and it ain't likely they'll lick the hull rebel army all-to-oncet the first time; but I think they'll fight better than some, if worse than others.
column3: Of course they ain't never been under fire yet, and it ain't likely they'll lick the hull rebel army all to oncet the first time; but I think they'll fight better than some, if worse than others.

column2: That's the way I figger.
column3: That's the way I figger.

column2: They call the reg'ment 'Fresh fish' and everything; but the boys come of good stock, and most of 'em 'll fight like sin after they oncet git shootin'," he added, with a mighty emphasis on the last four words.
column3: They call the reg'ment 'Fresh fish' and everything; but the boys come of good stock, and most of 'em 'l l fight like sin after they oncet git shootin'," he added, with a mighty emphasis on the last four words.

column2: Oh, you think you know-- began the loud soldier with scorn.
column3: Oh, you think you know- began the loud soldier with scorn.

column2: The other turned savagely upon him.
column3: The other turned savagely upon him.

column2: They had a rapid altercation, in which they fastened upon each other various strange epithets.
column3: They had a rapid altercation, in which they fastened upon each other various strange epithets.

column2: The youth at last interrupted them.
column3: The youth at last interrupted them.

column2: Did you ever think you might run yourself, Jim? he asked.
column3: Did you ever think you might run yourself, Jim? he asked.

column2: On concluding the sentence he laughed as if he had meant to aim a joke.
column3: On concluding the sentence he laughed as if he had meant to aim a joke.

column2: The loud soldier also giggled.
column3: The loud soldier also giggled.
